My posts, in reverse chronological order, in two sections:

  • One for software engineering and or computer science posts for people who know their monads from their monoids.
  • One for layperson-readable posts containing my attempts at learning to arrange words smartly and goodly.

Soft. Dev. / Comp. Sci.

Programming Language Semantics via Hoare Logic

2021-07-21

In 1967, as an alternative to \(\lAngle\) operational \(\rAngle\) semantics, Floyd produced his seminal paper ‘Assigning Meanings to Programs’ in which a program is given semantics via attachment of propositions to the connections in a flow chart with nodes as commands.

Tags: Hoare Logic Agda Program Correctness Verification Formal Proof
